structured.description: An `AuthenticationController` class that acts as a RESTful API for authentication purposes. The controller receives a `LoginRequest` object from the client and passes it to an `AuthenticationService` implementation for processing. Once the authentication is successful, the controller creates and returns a `ResponseEntity` object with the user ID and JWT token in the HTTP headers.

items.description: Is a Spring REST controller that implements the AuthenticationApi interface. It provides a login method that takes a valid LoginRequest object as input and returns a ResponseEntity with the user ID and JWT token in the HTTP headers. The class also includes a private method for creating the HTTP headers based on the returned AuthenticationData object.
items.name: AuthenticationController

items.description: Authenticates a user by calling the `loginService` and returning an `ResponseEntity` with the authentication data.

params.name: loginRequest
params.description: user's login details, containing the username and password for authentication by the `authenticationService`.

returns.description: a `ResponseEntity` object with an `OK` status and headers containing authentication data.

items.name: login

items.description: Creates HTTP headers with user ID and JWT token for login purposes based on input `AuthenticationData`.

params.name: authenticationData
params.description: user's login information, providing the user ID and JWT token for authentication purposes.

returns.description: a set of HTTP headers containing the user ID and JWT token for authentication purposes.

items.name: createLoginHeaders

structured.description: An integration test class, UserControllerIntegrationTest, which tests the registration functionality of a Spring Boot application using TestRestTemplate and UserRepository. The test creates a user through a POST request with a CreateUserRequest object and verifies that the response matches expectations.

items.description: Is an integration test for verifying the correct registration of users through a web service. It posts a user request to the registration path and checks if the response matches expectations. The test also verifies that the registered user's details are correctly stored in the database.
items.name: UserControllerIntegrationTest

items.description: Tests the successful signing up process by creating a new user with the provided name, email and password. It checks if the response status is CREATED, the returned user ID exists in the database and its corresponding values match the input.

usage.code:
CreateUserRequest requestBody = new CreateUserRequest().name("John").email("john@example.com").password("password123");
ResponseEntity<User> responseEntity = testRestTemplate.postForEntity(registrationPath, requestBody, User.class);

items.name: shouldSignUpSuccessful
